All Reviews

  1. Great battery life, charges quickly, trims very well. A little finicky regarding angles and such, but nothing to get upset about. It could be stronger in thicker hair patches, hence only 4 stars instead of 5.<br /><br />I would buy this again.
  2. I'm a proud owner of this shaver. I use it occasionally to keep my facial hair presentable.<br /><br />BUT THAT BATTERY THOUGH. It's gotta be lithium. It lasts forever. Admittedly, I only use it once a week, but the battery holds a charge for a very long time. I've charged it like twice over the many months I've owned it. (And unlike Ni-Cad batteries, Lithium batteries maintain their power output until the end.)<br /><br />I used this to give myself a buzzcut. That took some effort, but the battery lasted and it looks pretty good.<br /><br />The shaver does not claim to be water resistant, but I have rinsed the end of it while it was running, without any problems. But always let it dry out before reassembling and storing it, so that rust won't form.<br /><br />Cons:<br />The length dial is slippery when wet. It is hard to turn when my fingers are slippery, and I resort to using my fingernail, since it's rubberized.
  3. After 6 weeks, the battery completely drained and is no longer taking a charge. Of course I can't return it now because there's only a 30 day return policy. Internet shopping sucks sometimes. Regardless, it worked fine during the 6 weeks the battery lasted. Now I'm stuck with a broken down pair of clippers. Should make for a decent doorstopper.
  4. Best trimmer I've ever purchased! Great quilt! I have only had to charge it 3-4 times since I've owned it which has been a couple months.
  5. For every 5 hairs it trims it pulls one. I wonder if they actually USED the trimmer when they developed it?
  6. It's a little noisy and the slide on guard/adjustable attachment could use some redesigned other than that I like it
  7. Well, a little more than 1 year from purchase date and the charge doesn't last more than 3 minutes. This trimmer worked well when it held a charge. And you can't run it plugged in! Nice design Remington. Seems battery mode is the only mode. When the battery is gone, throw it out. Time to call Remington.
  8. BEST EVER ! I RESEARCHED A LOT BEFORE BUYING ONE AS I HAVE BEEN CUTTING BUSSING MY HAIR FOR MORE THAN 20 YEARS .. THIS LIVES UP TO ITS REVIEWS .. GREAT PRODUCT.

  10. Love this thing. Very powerful and cuts close to the face with the guard is not used. I have a thick beard and the thing takes down my beard nicely. No snags. Would recommend to anyone. Also, a complete charge lasts quite a while.

  15. Given the number of laudatory reviews, I expect my situation may be an anomaly. I had the trimmer for about a year, and as advertised, I did not have to charge it once. I was quite surprised. Now however, it is \\"dead\\" and won't charge.
  16. I bought this for my husband and he absolutely loves it.<br />He says it makes keeping his beard the right length so<br />easy. He has not had any problem with it pulling as some<br />have said. He says it is the best trimmer he has ever had!
  17. I use this to shorten my beard, hair on my head and my girlfriend uses it to trim my body hair. It shears through all of it no problem or bogging, and you don't have to have a cord so you can do it the garage or in the grass. Be advised though, demonstrate between the cutting side and the stabbing side. The difference is that the cutting side with cut the hair effortlessly with or against the grain and the stabbing side will result in bleeding.
  18. For $25, this is the best trimmer I have owned. The olde WAHL trimmer I had would catch on and hurt even after cleaning and oiling it.<br /><br />This thing blazes through the beard without any difficulty and with great comfort. The adjustable mechanism is really handy, sturdy, and easy-to-use.
  19. I am really surprised by the battery. I bought it almost three months ago and I use it every week for beard, mustache and hair. I didn't charge it yet. It runs very well and for the time being it is superior to the previous rechargeable I owned.
  20.   29. Very good lithium trimmer with built in cutting height adjustment. Compact enough to travel.
  30. This is a very handy trimmer. It comes with a tiny brush, power charger, three blades (goatee, stubble, trimmer) and a blade cover that can be adjusted to 9 different length. I have only had it one week, so I can not comment on the battery other than that it is holding a charge well so far. I like to keep a stubble appearance so I use a short setting and my beard is neatly kept/trimmed in a few seconds... very handy. I use to use a hair clippers set, but it was too big and awkward, this is a great size. The motor is plenty powerful. It works great as a body trimmer also, I use it for my stomach and chest on a short setting as well. I am really glad I spent the money and purchased this item. The only complaint I have is that the cover on my unit doesn't move/adjust between setting one and two. This doesn't bother me much because I don't need it any shorter than 2.
  31. Battery charge has gradually faded<br />After 1 1/2 years, battery only last a couple of minutes

  33. This really is the only groomer that you need. Nice quiet motor. Easy to dial in the exact length you want. Easy to clean. I use a brush to remove the hair and keep the comb attached. I use another trimmer if I want the closer stubble length just because I'm too lazy to remove the comb and this other trimmer has a nose hair attachment. It is a loud Norelco but came with different size combs that broke so I bought this Remington to replace it. The Remington comb stays firmly in place and has no weird fragile pieces likely to break. Keeps a charge over days of use. Good looking on the shelf too.
  34. So far this unit has kept it's charge better than expected. It cuts good and depth adjustment works well for me.

  36. long battery life, I haven't recharged it since I bought it. Light, and easy to maneuver. I've only used 1 of the 3 cutter heads so far.
  37. I've only used this once, but so far so good. If my past experience with the Remington brand still applies, I'm sure it will give me years of service. My last Remington lasted over 6 - 8 years, and I&#34;ve always had good luck with them so far - my favorite brand so I hope I'm not dissapointed. Here's what I like about this one - My last one had only one blade; I like that this one has the 3 blades because: 1) The stubble blade works great on my head and neck, and it trims much shorter than my last one ever did and this is great for me because I prefer to trim rather than shave those areas, 2) the detail blade makes it much easier to get the details nice and clean, 3) the main blade works well on my beard, and 4) I suspect that the blades will last longer since I'm using 3 blades, where in the past I only had one blade to do all the work. Here's what I'm not so fond of: I had to drop at least one star because it does not have a corded option. I knew this in advance, but the corded options lacked other features that I like, so I made this choice anyway, but why is it so difficult to give us the option? It's really irritating when I start to get ready for work or a night out, and my trimmer dies before the job is done. If they can't provide a corded option, I would at least like to have a gauge so I know I'm doomed if I don't charge it more first. I think this is something that should be fairly simple: many of my battery operated devices have a visual representation of how much charge is left, so the technology is anything but new. Come on Remington, give us a cord or a gauge, and this could well be the perfect trimmer for me!
  38. Absolutely pleased with this trimmer. I charged it completely when I received it and haven't had to recharge yet and it has been a couple of months. I use it 2-3 times per week
  39. Ouch. And blood. I tried it twice and got the same result both times. Do not put these blades anywhere near your skin. They will cut a ragged edge. Cannot be used to trim the edge of a beard. It's a very aggressive cutter with a lot of power so it chews you right up. It worked well for trimming my beard with the guard on it. It cuts in columns, but is so aggressive that two or three passes and it's good. My wahl trimmer took many passes and was never as good. I should use both of them, but since the Remington has cut me I'm wary of using it even with the guard. If I still had the box I would send it back. I don't understand the good reviews.
  40. I've been using the trimming extension on my electric shaver to shave my face because my skin is sensitive and breaks out/gets ingrown hairs if I shave with the foil or use a razor.   41. I bought this trimmer after my other one died on me. I was really excited about a new trimmer for my beard. Order arrived on time and exactly as advertised, but then I started to use it. Now, I've been shaving a loooong time, so I am familiar with how to operate and trim a beard so that is not a factor in this review. From the very first use, this trimmer pulled as many hairs as it cut. At first I chalked it up to me getting used to a new trimmer, but every time I used it it pulled hairs! OUCH! I tried less pressure, more pressure, different hand holds, different angles, I even had my wife try to do it for me but nothing worked. I soon found myself not wanting to trim my beard because it was so annoying. In all fairness, once the face-torture was over, my beard looked really good. The trimmer definitely performs well, but I could do without the constant pulling of hairs. I think it has something to do with the floating tines on the guard which none of my previous trimmers have had. Regardless, I'm now in the market for a new trimmer.

  47. I've not only purchased this razor once, but twice! I love it. I've sported a beard since I was about 14 years old, and it's become part of what people notice when they see me. It's always well-kept, and I'm more picky about how my beard looks than my hair. The great thing about this razor is not only that it does the job without pulling your hairs out, but that it comes with three different attachments. I only use one as I like my beard a certain way, but the second razor was purchased for my father who's been using the old razor & cream for years. I use this trimmer with absolutely zero cream/moisturizer, and never a painful moment. My father is now enjoying the new razor & able to shave in half the time. My beard grows a lot faster than most, and I'm constantly trimming it every other day. With that said & given the thickness of my beard, I'm able to charge it once per month...sometimes two. It's a great battery & overall great razor! I highly recommend it if not for the quality, for the price!

  62. The razor worked great for one year, and then it very rapidly began to decline. It's a well built enough razor, and though it can take several passes for a clean cut, it does the job aptly enough. For the money it costs, however, it should not start going dead within a minute of turning it on...plugged in or not.<br /><br />The razor has no indicator as to whether it is successfully charging or not. The blades are made of solid material, but a lot of the razor is fragile and plastic. Overall, for the money it costs, you would be better off opting for one of Remington's low cost models that do about the same sort of job and last about the same amount of time. If you want a piece of equipment that lasts, this isn't it.

The blades are sharp, I like the built-in adjuster for the trim guard, it really is a great package.<br /><br />I'm one of those guys that was born with a beard, can shave in the morning and have real stubble by the end of the day, so I gave up on shaving a long time ago and basically every couple days run the trimmer over my face, mow down the side burns and make sure the goatee isn't getting too out of control, and this little trimmer does it all very well and hasn't shown any signs of slowing down yet.   83. I had an earlier version of a Remington and this model is very much better. As others have said, the duration of a charged battery is hugely better than the old model that used NiCad batteries. The built in cutting depth adjustment feature works perfectly and the interchangeable cutting blades are clearly well crafted and do exactly as promised. All-in-all a fine product.<br /> ________________________________________________________________________________________________________<br />UPDATE - * BAD BATTERY !! * After a little over two years of just light use the battery will no longer hold a charge. Now a person may think that two years is long enough but not when you consider the specifics. In my case, I give myself a beard trim and haircut about once every three weeks and this takes about 15 minutes at the most. Therefore over the 27 months that I was using this cutter I would have actually used it about 38 times. Compare that to my Braun electric toothbrush with I use for two minutes twice per day - every day and has been going strong for years (I don't even remember when I bought it) . . . and is still working great. The electrical effort to operate my toothbrush is very similar to what is required to vibrate the cutter blades of a hair trimmer. I believe that Remington has either designed this cutter with an undersized battery and/or they are using poor quality batteries.<br /><br />Bottom line . . . it's a good quality cutter but be prepared to buy a new one about every two years. Personally, I decided to try another brand this time.
  84. First one died out after 2 months....Pulls and rips out hair
  85. After only 6 months the battery has stopped holding a charge for more than a minute or two so I would not recommend buying this product. I contacted Remington and received no response from their customer service. I have since purchased a similar Braun product and definitely won't purchase any Remington times in the future.
  86. Very satisfied with this purchase. Lithium Ion battery is noticeably more powerful than the old NiCad trimmer I replaced. Cuts hair cleanly without pulling and I find I do not have to go over the same areas as much as I used to in order to get an even trim.<br /><br />Wanted to point out the plastic height adjustment / guard since when I was shopping for this I really had to dig to find info about it. Works about the same as previous trimmers I have used in the past, but seems sturdier with a thicker plastic. I have had a guard break on me before (different brand/model) and I don't see that happening with this one. Looks like they updated the images since I bought mine, so you can actually see for yourself.<br /><br />LOVE the interchangeable blades. Though I have a goatee I just use the beard trimmer and it does the job. The stubble blade is excellent for more delicate areas. Since the gaps between the teeth are so much narrower it does not catch skin in between like I have experienced (painfully) with other trimmers. It is also very easy to sterilize in between uses since you can just pop the blades out with the press of a button.
  87. Awesome shaver, I use it daily and does an amazing job.
  88. Exactly what my husband needed and he loves it.

  92. Have used it for months now and love it. The battery life lasts for a VERY long time. Great product.

However, after awhile I noticed that hair had become stuck under the top metal trimmer attachment. I popped it off and washed it. It worked for another day but then the battery died permanently :(<br /><br />So the product says it is &#34;washable&#34; but I would use a brush instead of rinsing it. The battery can get water on it when the metal head is popped off so keep that in mind. I also noticed that the metal under the trimmer head had rusted pretty bad. I'm not sure if it affected the performance as all the moving parts seems to be rust-resistant. For a $30 trimmer it probably isn't any better than a $15 Wahl trimmer from target or amazon.<br /><br />Pros: gets job done. comfortable to use.<br />Cons: Rusts, expensive, and not washable.

I find that in order to obtain an even trim I have to go over the same area multiple times.<br /><br />I have naturally dark, coarse facial hair. I also am starting to get some gray peppered in. One issue that I've had with other trimmers is that some of them tend to pull my hair due to the coarseness of it. The MB4040 doesn't pull. It is powerful enough to trim without pulling.<br /><br />The main drawback is the gray hair. For some reason I haven't been able to find a trimmer that will trim these stray hairs along with the dark hair. So, I have to go over the gray hairs a few times in order for the trimmer to cut them.....or else I would have short dark hair with long gray hairs.<br /><br />The biggest positive is the battery life. I've had this trimmer for a few weeks. I use it once or twice a week, and have only had to charge it one time.<br /><br />Overall, I would recommend this product - especially if you have thinner facial hair.

  131. I've used the MB series trimmers before and would give them 5 stars except for their battery life. Trimmed great and awesome adjustable/removable guard with the scroll wheel/number system. However, they would always last for about a year then not hold a charge well and you'd have to buy a new one. If only the battery was better!<br /><br />So, Remington comes out with the Lithium Ion battery version. That's great and now the trimmer is perfect, right!?!? Well, they also, FOR NO REASON WHATSOEVER, decided, \\"Wow we need to redesign our new trimmer to show off the new fancy battery!\\" Instead of just replacing the battery pack, they redesigned the body of the trimmer, new shape, added crappy plastic chrome and such, but the problem is the guard was also changed. Now the guard will catch on your beard and pull hairs every couple of seconds or so. I have a short beard and it will pull any length hair. This makes painful trimming! Also, for some reason I find I have to go over my face many more times to get all the hairs that used to stand up better, and therefore get trimmed with fewer passes, using the old guard.<br /><br />Now I use this trimmer only for certain things: for under my nose, fading into my hairline, and without the guard. I use a Phillips Norelco (the vacuum type) for the rest which is 95% of my face. The P.N. trims MUCH faster with fewer passes. It just has that bulky vacuum that gets in the way, and the guard adjustment measuring system is completely useless as it doesn't line up with any of the measurements.<br /><br />Having to use 2 different trimmers sucks, but neither do the job completely (anymore). I recommend passing on the Lithium Ion version of the Remington and just get the other models with the old battery and just know you'll have to replace it every year or so, and you'll need to remember to charge it after/before every use.

  169. I only shave once per week, so I don't bother to aim for a clean shave because that would be rough on my skin, and because I like the unshaven look. The plastic guard can be set for ten different cutting lengths, &#34;1&#34; being the shortest. I always use setting &#34;1&#34; and found that it didn't cut short enough to look like an unshaven shave. It looked more like a very tightly trimmed beard. I was unhappy with that but kept it because it has great battery life and mechanical reliability. I recharge once a month and could probably go longer between charges. By chance I discovered that on setting &#34;1&#34; I can turn the shaver upside-down and it gives me a significantly closer shave, leaving me with stubble only. This is exactly what I wanted.

  187. First, let me state that these clippers are good, but I wanted something that I can have a ONE OVER and get a shadow look, and they cut too close. By Shadow, I mean maybe a NEAT 3-4 day look, not 1 day look.
  188. I bought this trimmer to turn a one-year wizard beard into something more respectable. The trimmer does very well, and keeps everything tidy. The actual trimming blade is very good at what it does. My thick curly beard hairs are cut with no pulling. The dial to adjust the guard length is sturdy, so you're less likely to accidentally trim your beard much shorter than you intend. For some of the harder spots on your face, typically under the neck, you might have to use one hand to hold your hair while you trim, but this is an issue with any trimmer in this price range. For even the harder spots, I go over my face 2-3 times to get my beard trimmed as I want. The after cleanup could be improved, but only takes about a minute. There are a lot of small grooves under the trimmer for hair to get stuck in, so you'll want to keep some canned air. I can't speak for the shorter trimmers, but if they're like the beard trimmer, this will do a great job turning your face into a mansterpiece.<br /><br />One major issue with this trimmer is it's built with the durability of a five-dollar trimmer. I bought this only two months ago, and I'm already having major issues with the motor not starting. Even with a full charge, I have to try over and over again--turning off and then back on--to get it to start. What works for me is shaking the device down as I turn it on, like I'm shaking water off it. Even for a $30 device, I should get at least six months before major issues. Unfortunately, Remington's warranty is only for 60 days. Adding to that, the device snaps together and screws in such that you can't figure out how to open it up and fix any issue you get, so it's not easy to fix it.<br /><br />All in all, great when it lasts, but it's not built well enough to last that long, and not easy to fix. I'd recommend as a cheap trimmer to hold you over while you save up for something good.
  189. I bought this for my husband and he likes it and uses it often. He wore out one of these already.
  190. I'm 47 years old and have NEVER attempted growing any facial hair...US Air Force and now ex-wife would not allow it...so this is my first shot at growing a beard -- it's coming in a bit spotty. I ordered this to trim it up, and upon initial use, I'm gonna keep trying, as it evened out my scruff well & worked smoothly...
  191. There are two things in life so simple that you can not screw it up. One is cole slaw and the other a beard trimmer. But somehow, they did. Remington is a name I've known and trusted for over 50 years, but this trimmer cannot hold a candle to the cheaper Braun that it replaced. I have to go over and over an area, and even then it's just a bad, uneven trim. I've read the manual. Done everything right. It's just bad. Really bad.
  192. I ordered this around Christmas 2012 hoping to find a decent trimmer that I could use around twice a week. The battery finally ran out of charge today (Sept 20 2013). Incredible battery and great design.
  193. Very good..serves u well to maintain stubble.
  194. No problems with battery life. Actual performance is bad. With one right out of the box I've had to go over the same spot 40+ times to make it decent (plenty of stubborn hairs left). It's junk.
  195. Had other models, this is the best so far. Like the different metal heads
  196. Probably the best value out of all of the trimmers. And certainly one of the best trimmers for numerous reasons: Lithium batteries are simply the best. The other types are much cheaper, but wear out often inside of a year. Lithium lasts for many years, and this holds a charge for well over an hour. Mine's three years old, and I took it on a month long vacation last summer, used it every other day, no charger no problem.<br /> Plus these batteries have more torque to keep the blades moving through thick hair without getting stuck and binding. It also has excellent commercial style blades compared to other brands. And the build overall is a very simple commercial build- You don't have to keep swapping out parts to get through your morning routine. The thick plastic guard stays on the unit and there's a handy wheel to click the height up and down. And the guard pops off easily to &#34;shave&#34; or trim tight around your beard or goatee. For instance I have a goatee, so I pull of the guard, and use the blade alone directly against my skin to &#34;shave&#34; my face except for my goatee. And then I pop the guard on and trim my goatee.<br /> One move and super easy. As an FYI, Remington recommends the Main (not the stubble) blade for the closest cut. You have to be a tad bit careful directly against the skin, but not very. This blade gives me about a one day stubble, which most days is clean enough for me. And when I need to I shave with a blade. The stubble blade has much finer teeth, but oddly shaves to about a two day/ slightly longer cut. And for my thick hair, the stubble blade catches way more. I leave the main blade on all the time. After three years it seems to be dulling a bit, so I just ordered two new blades online from Remington for $7.99 each. Nice they offer those, since the unit will likely last for years. In short, it's industrial, simple to use, and works great, which keeps things simple for me, just the way I like it!
  197. Worked well initially, but after 10 months of light use the battery won't recharge to full and doesn't last long enough to trim my beard. I followed the user manual instructions for fully discharging and recharging the batteries, but no luck. Defective battery.
  198. didn't work for me ,pinches no stand for it I donated it to charity
  199. Works great, great power, easy to use and easy to adjust the height. The only thing that keeps me from giving it the extra star is it doesn't have a stand. Great trimmer though and would recommend it to any guy.

  205. Absolutely ridiculous. I've had this trimmer for not even a whole year and the battery will NOT hold a charge anymore. I never write Amazon reviews, but I feel I'm obligated to let everyone know so that they do not buy this trimmer despite the high average rating for this product.<br /><br />A little background: I use this trimmer to trim my beard maybe once, twice weekly, averaging a use of up to 1 hour a week, and that's being generous. I started off using an old model of Remington's trimmers (now discontinued, used batteries) and had to upgrade once the trimmer attachment broke. I decided on the MB200 which has THE SAME PROBLEM as this one: the battery fails to hold a charge after a few months' use. I ended up buying this one after the MB200 failed and, sure enough, the SAME THING HAPPENS WITH THIS MODEL. Neither of the chargers will trim for longer than 2 minutes now. I guess you get what you pay for, but Remington seriously needs to rethink the products they're putting out. Because of this, I won't be buying another cheap Remington product again.

  212. I grow a goatee for a few months each winter and need to trim it about once a week. For the last 10 years, I've used a very simply designed Norelco trimmer with no complicated attachments. Unfortunately, the Norelco died on me a few months ago. I set out in search of a simple trimmer and purchased the Remington MB4040 rechargeable trimmer, which looks somewhat like the old Norelco.<br /><br />I have now used the Remington trimmer about 6 times. It is horrible; possibly the worst designed product I've ever seen. Its intended purpose is to trim hair without trimming skin and it fails miserably. The blade cover is flexible...what genius thought that was a good idea? The flexible cover prevents uniform hair length trimming and allows the blade to contact skin. Do their engineers test products before production?<br /><br />Initially convinced it was a user error, I have tried to shave with the trimmer in every conceivable orientation, but it still pulls hair and nicks skin...EVERY TIME. I shave like a nervous cat now, expecting the painful tug & tear at any moment.<br /><br />I have purchased hundreds of products from Amazon over the years and maybe left one prior review. That should tell you something about my feeling on this crummy product.<br /><br />Run from this thing. I am going to search for a replacement and get rid of this medieval torture device.

  217. My first trimmer and it works well. I find I keep a shorter beard because it is easier. I bought it thinking the 5/8&#34; max setting (9) would be too short. I find myself using half that because it is easier to keep. Placing the plastic guard on does require looking at the shape, but it only fits on one way. The setting stays set even when you remove and replace the guard. As a first time user the hardest thing for me was to learn to hold the unit perpendicular to the face. This seems obvious once you use it for a while, but the curved design makes one want to hold it like a toothbrush. You can trim up your hair or make shaving less painful by pre-trimming the areas I shave. After a few days a shave can be a little uncomfortable, but pre-trimming helps solve that problem. The battery charged quickly the first time and I have not charged it for a couple weeks. I plan to charge it about every two weeks. There is no pulling with any of the blades. Longer beards are harder to trim because hair can stay curled below the cutting surface which is why I went to a shorter beard. It is a great product, and for the price, it is a good value.
  218. Great Product I like it, it is sharp enough for trimming. Remington are known to be good products, I might get one more for my brother

If I ran out of battery life while I was trimming, I think I would be a sasquatch, but more likely it is probably for traveling and not taking the charger with you. ANyhow, no complaints and works well, what more can you ask for, right?

  237. This is my second Remington mustache and beard trimmer. The first lasted several years, but the non-replaceable rechargeable battery finally reached the end of its useable life. As of this review I have used the new trimmer for about 5 weeks. I am still on the original charge, but use it only an average of 3 times a week. My use is for trimming my mustache, sideburns and eyebrows. Although it can also be used to trim your head hair. The motor is strong and well made. Of the three supplied blades I only use the beard blade, which was preinstalled on the shaver. The adjustable comb attachment fits over the blade easily and has several calibration setting using the numbered zoom wheel. I use the comb attachment mainly when trimming and shaping my mustache. Once I have used the comb it easily slides off and then you can use the blade to trim sideburns and shape the mustache line. I find the adjustable dial for the removeable head a great convenience. You do not have to have a variety of attachable heads as with others on the market. As with my first trimmer, I suspect the trimmer can not be run using the electrical outlet if the battery is run down. I am very pleased with its performance and because I travel a lot not having a charging base is a big plus.
  238. This is a fine trimmer. I got it after my old Philips got too worn down to use. This one is slightly larger, which is both good and bad. Good is that it feels weighty and does the job.   275. I'm the kind of guy who typically runs things into the ground. You've met guys like me. I keep a car for sixteen years and sell it out of my driveway. I run a riding lawnmower until its creaking on its springs and gasping on its last exhaustive breath. The same holds true for my old Remington beard trimmer.<br /><br />And yes, I purchase Remington because I am a Remington. I guess it runs in the family.<br /><br />About seven years ago I purchased almost the exact same trimmer, although it was silver in color and back then it had an internal chamber to hold hair. I really liked that old trimmer, but in typical fashion, I ran it to death. A year ago it only held a charge for four or five minutes, and now it holds a charge for about thirty seconds. So I decided it's time; it's time to replace it with a new one.<br /><br />The difference between the Remington MB4040 trimmer and my old one is this trimmer doesn't have a vacuum feature that sucks the hair trimmings into an internal chamber that can be emptied when I'm done trimming. Boy that was a nice feature! I miss it. So I chose the next best thing, the same trimmer without that feature, and I'm happy with it. Now I have to trim in the shower with the water off or over a sink, otherwise the trimmings land all over the floor. I can't fault the trimmer for that though.<br /><br />The nice thing about the MB4040 is it holds a charge seemingly forever. Or perhaps it just feels like it does because my old one wouldn't hold a charge at all. Remington specs it at a 120-minute run time, which is really impressive. This one uses lithium-ion cells instead of the nickel-cadmium (NiCad) cells my old trimmer had. I've had to charge this new one once in about a month, and it still has a healthy charge.<br /><br />The MB4040 comes with three different trim cutters, a removable guard that can be adjusted to nine different depth levels, and a brush to clean hair out of all the nooks and crannies. Along with a charger, it has everything you need to enjoy any kind of hair trimming. Remington markets this as a beard trimmer, but my experience has been that it can be used for any type of body hair: beard, mustache, head, or other personal area. I don't have a beard, but I use it around the outside of my head to keep it closely trimmed, and my wife uses it on our toddler. It saves a ton of money than bringing him to a barber, which is difficult to do with a two year old.<br /><br />So our experience with this product is a good one, and even though my name is Remington, I stay with Remington because trimmers like this seem to last a real long time. For the money, they work for me. I stick with things that work for me. For about $30, the Remington MB4040 is a great product.ng you need to enjoy any kind of hair trimming. Remington markets this as a beard trimmer, but my experience has been that it can be used for any type of body hair: beard, mustache, head, or other personal area. I don't have a beard, but I use it around the outside of my head to keep it closely trimmed, and my wife uses it on our toddler. It saves a ton of money than bringing him to a barber, which is difficult to do with a two year old.<br /><br />So our experience with this product is a good one, and even though my name is Remington, I stay with Remington because trimmers like this seem to last a real long time. For the money, they work for me. I stick with things that work for me. For about $30, the Remington MB4040 is a great product.

  289. I was waiting to write a review until I had to recharge this trimmer after the initial charge. I ordered this trimmer on March 3rd 2012 and as of June 12th I still have not had to recharge it. If you've had one of those trimmers with multiple attachments that sit in a poorly designed stand that seems to spill half of them out on the bathroom counter whenever you are trying to use one of them you will appreciate this trimmer. It is easy to keep clean, and has a rotary dial to adjust the length of cut. Although the different trimmer heads are easy to swap in and out my primary use is to trim my goatee. I am very satisfied with it's simplicity and long lasting battery. I have not experienced any pulling or other discomfort as another reviewer has mentioned.

It's reasonably quiet, cuts nicely, recharges well. It would be nice if the trimmer worked from the charger for those occasions when you might have a discharged or own out battery, but the manual says the charger only charges the battery and can't be used to run the trimmer. Nothing dramatic about it, but you don't want drama with personal care!
  301. This unit has a power motor and long lasting charge. I have charged it twice in two months and it is used every 3 days or so. I even used it to give myself a haircut trim when I couldn't get to the shop on time. It did not need the charge I gave it, as it would have lasted quite a bit longer.<br /><br />Unless I read the instructions incorrectly, I prefer to use it opposite of the way they recommend. I prefer to use it with the Power button and Adjustment roller facing me, not pointing away. I get a much more &#34;regular&#34; trim in that position. It does a nice job of closely trimming my mustache (use it at the lowest level), and maintains the goat effectively at any length I choose.. It is easy to clean and charges in a few hours.<br /><br />I can't find anything to complain about. It is far superior to my previous Remington. I was in need of a new trimmer and after considerable research, decided on the Remington MB4040.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Great battery life - only needs a full charge every week or two depending on your usage<br />- Easy to clean<br />- Easy-to-use length adjustment<br />- Only requires one pass to trim your beard, which is a great time saver.<br />- Good cost for the features<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Horrible for shaving down to a stubble - as others have mentioned, if you don't use the skin guard, the clipper teeth often catch on my skin/hair/any little bump on my face, particularly when shaving the neck area.   342. It's an inexpensive trimmer so don't expect a lot, but you get a lot for your money for sure. It does give you the stubble look. Those saying they can't have this happen easily need to watch the instructional video that Remington provides on youtube, it shows how to properly use it. It's not as intuitive as you might think and I suspect many people are using the device wrong. I shave with the stubble blade without the guard and have a perfect stubble look.<br /><br />As others have said, when you shave with the bare blade only use the stubble blade for that..if you use the larger blade you could cut yourself..the larger blade is intended to be used with the guard for your actual hair. The battery lasts forever and it is light and relatively quiet, easy to clean.

If you go upward on your neck, it'll cut you and leave rashes.<br />The beard trimmer length options are extremely skewed toward long beards. There's not really anything between barely stubble to short beard. If you have a longer beard though, there are tons of options.<br />Also, the beard trimmer will give you a closer shave on the chin than on the cheeks so you have to be careful.<br /><br />That said, this thing also trims everything down on the first swipe, unlike most other electric razors. It also holds its charge unbelievably well. I've had it about a month and haven't had to charge it yet.

After using it now for a few weeks, I assess its performance, ergonomics, battery, and comfort, to be every bit as good as the Norelco, and, perhaps, even better, since the battery is lithium-ion, (you can read the product description for its benefits), and the cutters self-sharpening titanium. It's light in the hand, and the motor is powerful. It's one of the few times these days when saving money on a product actually returned greater satisfaction. I've been using it over a month now and have yet to charge it for a second time. Previous shavers I've had never held a charge for a full month.   381. Switched to this model from the Remington B200 after much good use but the battery failed eventually. The battery on this one is very good and the cutting is fairly good, however I am overall dissatisfied given that after only a year and a half the switch to turn the unit on and off has failed.<br /><br />Initially the problem was that I had to press in as hard as possible while sliding the switch in order to get it to turn on. Finally that stopped working also. Took the unit apart and discovered that it worked perfectly fine when the the cover was not on, the cover switch does not perfectly line up with or maneuver the actual switch that is internal to the shaver. I modified it by trimming away some of the cover plastic to allow the cover switch to be more recessed and slide further and got it working again. Clearly though this should not be necessary.

The second one I received was in-tact, but as soon as I removed the Stubble Trimmer from the packaging, that blade assembly came apart too. I tried for about 30 minutes to put it back together, suffering a few scratches and cuts on my fingers, and then I finally gave up. I realize that someone reading this review will probably make fun of me for not being able to figure out how to put this thing back together, but I'm manning up and admitting it anyway.   387. I've tried tons of razors, electric razors, and even double edged razors. This is the easiest on my skin for every day shaving. When I need a close shave I go to my double edged razor, which is the only way I can get a proper shave without breaking out. Most days, I just use this. It is faster, easier, and I like that even without the guard that it leave a tiny bit of stubble.<br /><br />This is also my 16 year old's preferred method.
  388. Good for keeping a beard cropped in an even fashion. Easiest if you go over the whole beard at the same setting.<br />Setting '2' is much more closely cropped than '3' .
  389. I have had this trimmer for almost a year now and it is holding up great. My only issue is that it takes multiple passes to get an even trim. I don't feel like I had as much of an issue with my previous trimmer.<br /><br />Pros: Holds charge for a long time<br /> Powerful<br /> Light weight<br /> Easily adjustable<br /><br />Cons: Guard doesn't always provide the best trim on first couple passes
  390. When my last hair trimmer (also made by Remington), after many years of reliable use finally died, I started looking for another one.<br />This one is even better, and sturdier than previous one.<br />Higly recommended.
  391. After a year of using this 2-4 times per week, the battery does not hold a charge sufficient to trim my beard. It runs for less than 5 minutes.<br /><br />Other than that, this is a good basic trimmer.
  392. My wife ordered this to replace an older model because of the longer-life battery. So I am writing the review.   393. Perfect beard shaver. Charge lasts a very long time.
  394. I got this trimmer last year for Christmas. I've only charged it once and that was the day after I got it. I don't use it every day; I use it about once every two weeks.   395. Had I written a review last winter, it would have been 4 or 5 stars as I grew my first beard ever and tried various trimmers, and this was the best one I tried that would get close without getting too close (one of the guards on the others resulted in me always nicking myself in an unintended place and my beard-growing efforts would be for naught until I found this). However, now it's not quite a year later and the shaver is not holding a charge.   396. I have been through a few cordless chargers over the years and this one is, by far, the best one I have ever had. It is the first lithium one I have ever had, so there's that.   398. For the longest time I was trimming my beard with a pair of Wahl clippers that I bought on sale at target. Don't get me wrong, that's a great product, but it's designed more for your head than for your face.<br /><br />I finally decided to look up smaller cordless beard trimmers and after reading lots of reviews on Amazon, I decided on this on. Other reviews for other products should have fancy things like vacuum to suck away the trimmings, and water proof so you can use it in the shower. But I just wanted something that would give me a good trim every time.<br />So far I've only used the regular beard attachment, so I can speak to the goatee or the stubble attachments, but I've had nothing but good results with what I'm using. The length gauge is a nice simple dial, just turn it to what you want. Maybe start longer and go down from there on the first day so you don't over cut.<br /><br />I have pretty thick hair, so sometimes I need to make a few passes, but the razor just keeps on cutting through, even when my grain suddenly changes direction.<br /><br />I like that the comb attachment catches a lot of the hair trimmings, so I have less of a mess to clean up after.<br /><br />Overall, my trim time has reduced significantly, while the quality of my beard has increased quite a lot. This is a good product.

  408. I was slightly turned off by some of the negative reviews of this product, but after reading a bunch of reviews on many other trimmers I decided to chance it, and order this one. I am so glad I did!<br /><br />First, if the packaging is any reflection of the quality of this trimmer, then I'm sure it will outlast the cockroaches in the event of some nuclear fallout. Once I FINALLY got this thing out of the package's relentless grasp, I did as instructed, and charged the device for 24 hours (almost...). That is the last time I charged this thing, and it's still going strong. The battery seems very good, and if properly maintained seems like it will last for a long time.<br /><br />I like the size/weight of this trimmer--it fits nicely in my hand and feels like it is a quality product. The plastic comb seems pretty sturdy, and all serviceable pieces are easily removed. I love that there is only one comb, and length is adjustable. The whole thing is just one unit, and there is little need to fiddle with separate pieces unless you want to change the blade head. There is no bag or stand or anything, so I put all of the external parts in my own bag so I don't lose them, but that's no big loss really.<br /><br />The blades are sharp, (although I haven't had this long enough to dull them) and cut hair with ease. Edging with the bare blade is no problem at all and my beard looks great! This trimmer functions very well, and I am very satisfied with the trimmer's performance.<br /><br />The ONLY reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because there is the OCCASIONAL hair that slips its way past the comb and doesn't get cut as closely, but it's nothing drastic. If I comb my beard first, and straighten out all the hairs in the same direction it really doesn't happen much.<br /><br />All in all I am very satisfied with my purchase, and would recommend this product to anybody out there looking for a well-functioning and quality-made trimmer for a reasonable price. Sure you could do better, but you could also do a lot worse, and for this price it's about as good as it gets!<br /><br />----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br />Just a short update, I have been using this trimmer regularly since I purchased it, and I still have yet to charge it again. The instructions say that for best battery results it should be completely discharged about once a month and left on the charger for about 24 hours, and I'm starting to think I'm going to have to leave it running until it dies. I just can't seem to kill this battery with normal usage. I've also learned to use it so that I very rarely have missed hairs anymore. Been at least two months, and I'm still loving this product!a lot worse, and for this price it's about as good as it gets! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Just a short update, I have been using this trimmer regularly since I purchased it, and I still have yet to charge it again. The instructions say that for best battery results it should be completely discharged about once a month and left on the charger for about 24 hours, and I'm starting to think I'm going to have to leave it running until it dies. I just can't seem to kill this battery with normal usage. I've also learned to use it so that I very rarely have missed hairs anymore. Been at least two months, and I'm still loving this product!

  464. Went a week without shaving during a June trip to Yellowstone Park and for the first time, my facial hair came in gray. My wife loved the newly discovered salt and pepper look but wasn't a big fan once my stubble went into full Grizzly Adams mode after a week. Yes, my hair grows in quickly. Hence, the need for a trimmer with a stubble attachment to keep everything neat. Did some research on Amazon and after reading hundreds of reviews on a dozen trimmers, went for the Remington MB040.<br /><br />Here's what I like: The height wheel is really nice - at #2 or #3, I get a nice &#34;three day stubble look&#34;. I use the lowest setting #1 to trim around my mustache and chin area - where the hair tends to get quickly out of control. The guard also easily removes for precise trimming around the next line and stray hairs in the cheek area. The battery also lasts a long time. If I use the trimmer 2 to 3 times per week, I'm only charging the unit once every couple of weeks.<br /><br />My one complaint is that the trimmed hair goes everywhere but I didn't want a noisy vacuum attachment, so I knew I would have to deal with a mess after trimming. I suggest you do the trimming in the shower or in front of the sink with a towel spread on the counter. Overall, excellent buy and my wife is happy. Happy wife, happy life.

I went to this because I was getting a rash from a close shave with a safety razor and I never really liked an electric razor. This gives me about a days growth look which is hip and at 57 years old, hip is good.
  476. Really happy with this shaver. It's great for trimming around beard and also for taking down extra long stubble between extended shaves. Seems to last a very long time on one charge. (Battery died) Bought a new one, but took the old one apart and will be replacing the battery so I have two. Everything else is still working on the old one.

  478. Purchased November, 2013. Until now, it has been a useful tool and nearly 2 years is pretty good for the price point.   479. Great beard trimmer it is perfect
  480. I purchased this 9 months ago. It has not been on the charger since the first night. I use it minimum of 4 times a week. This trimmer rocks! Consistent, comfortable and keeps a ridiculous charge. Can't beat it!
  481. I bought this as a birthday present for my boyfriend and he loves it! Not bad for the price with all the accssories that come with this product.
  482. The stubble trimmer kept cutting me. You would think I would have stopped after the 4th cut, but no, I went for lucky number 5. Sent it back to Amazon, glad they make returns so easy. It was very sharp though, and really cut things.
  483. Cons: UPDATED<br />- Guard is not rigid, it is flimsy.<br />- Doesn't come with oil. Although they say it doesn't require it, but it is written in the manual that if you clean the blades with water you need to lubricate the blades with oil.<br />- It will not give you sharp outlines. You better buy Wahl Detailor, or Andis T trimmers.<br />- Trimming using the guard isn't precise.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Long battery life, with less battery drainage.<br />- Includes 3 different blades which is helpful.<br />- Many length settings.<br />- Powerful motor get the job done.<br />- Easy blades removal.<br />- Easy to clean the trimmer.<br />- Good grip, and ergonomically designed.<br /><br />Bottom line:<br />- Not great for edging the mustache, and beard, If your beard or mustache was long it would do the job.<br />- Will not give precise trimming.<br />- Great battery, that is the biggest pro in it<br />- This mainly would be good for shaving the entire beard before using a razor blade, line up sideburns, back of head, and over the ears, or if you want a stubble look.<br /><br />Update: 14/06/2014<br />I'm only putting this update to rave about the battery life, and performance.<br />This trimmer is no longer being used for my facial hair, it's now an armpit hair trimmer.<br />I had to get a better trimmer which is Andis superliner.<br /><br />Update: 20/06/2017<br />It's been been over 3 years with this trimmer.<br />Works like day one. No battery issues at all.<br />The battery life is very impressive, it will not drain much when put on shelf.<br /><br />Update: 27/06/2017<br />The battery is almost dead. It charged for 25 minutes, and worked for 3.5 minutes.<br />Now, after draining the battery fully, and charging it. It will charge for 5 minutes then, the led turns off, as if it's fully charged.<br />then, after 2~3 minutes, the led turns back on by itself, as if it's charging. I waited for 1 hour, and disconnect it.<br />So, I turned on the trimmer, and it worked for only 3 minutes. So, the battery is almost dead.<br /><br />This has served me for 3 years, and 6 months.<br />Now, I'll head to the store, and buy a 14500 lithium ion battery, and replace it. Hope everything goes back to normal.ty. - Isn't water proof. - Doesn't support 220v. Only 110v - loud sound. - Guard is not rigid, it is flimsy. I think it is less durable. Cruzer 6 guard is better. - Doesn't come with oil. Although they say it doesn't require it, but it is written in the manual that if you clean the blades with water you need to lubricate the blades with oil. - If your beard or mustache is short, edging results will not be satisfying, but for longer hair like sideburns it would do the job. - Trimming using the guard isn't precise. Look to my update down bellow. Pros: - Long battery life, with less battery drainage. - Includes 3 different blades which is helpful. - Many length settings. - Powerful motor compared to Cruzer 6. - Better trimming in the neck, but needs several passes. - Easy blades removal. - Easy to clean the trimmer. - Good grip, and positioning of blade. When I was using Cruzer 6 the trimmer head wasn't easy to use it to do precise trimming. To be more clear, I don't have a good view of what I am trimming, the braun cruzer 6 [ Face shaver model ] trimmer head is placed in a weird position that I have a difficult time seeing what I am going to trim. I'm not saying it is hard, but MB4040 is easier, that's all. I cannot make a professional review, since I am not a hairstylist. I am a person who doesn't wan't to waste he's time at the barber shop. So in order to make my review more helpful I compared it to another beard trimmer. I will update my review with time. UPDATE: 3/2/2014 I have tried to use this trimmer for trimming my beard ( not shaving it ) with the guard. When I trimmed my sideburns on level 5 the result was good. BUT, when I trimmed the hair under my lips the result were OK. I Said to myself to push the the trimmer head a little bit, and the hairs were shorter. I thought maybe when I was not pushing it too hard the result wasn't accurate, but when I pushed a little bit it trimmed shorter. So, I said why not push more? The result was horrible. Some of the hairs were short, and are gone, some isn't equal in height to other hairs! I knew the reason before I started trimming, you wanna know why? Because the trimmer guard is FLIMSY, NOT HARD, ISN'T ENGINEERLY WILL DESIGNED! So, my recommendation to those people who ( only/main reason ) needs this product for trimming their beard is DON'T BUY IT. Reason? The guard will not give you a smooth accurate length of hair. As humans we might press strongly in this spot, and press gently in another spot while trimming, right? So, the product will not satisfy you in what you need it to do. As for my needs, this product fulfills them :), and the 5 stars remain :) If you read this REMINGTON, then please change the guard to a new one, with a rigid structure. UPDATE: 14/5/2014 My initial review was influenced by my past bad experience with Braun Cruzer 6. So, it was giving you the impression that I am happy about the product, which I was at the beginning. Because I have Braun 790 I wasn't paying attention that this product lack the precision, because the shaver cleans the small hairs after it. So, it's down to this: - Edging sideburns is good, because the hair is usually long, so it's easy to edge it. - Edging the mustache is NOT precise if your mustache is not long. I mean if it's around 5mm. You would try to edge it multiple times, and you still would not get the perfect result. Because I have Braun 790, it will clean those small hairs, and would give me a better shave around the edges of my mustache. It would look cleaner than before. Bottom line: - Not great Edging of the mustache, and beard &#34; If your beard or mustache was long u wouldn't notice much, but if it was short you would notice &#34; - Great battery, that is the biggest pro in it - This mainly would be good for shaving the entire beard. - Not aimed for a professional shave. Yes, with only this machine, you will not feel that you got the same shave you'd get at a barber shop. This is not a good trimmer, but it's decent. If you got the money then consider two companies, Andis & Wahl. They have great trimmers, especially those wired ones. Yes, many would like wireless, but the wired ones have the power to edge, and trim with breeze. Go to YouTube, and see. I am thinking to go with the Andis T Trimmers &#34; T-Outliner &#34; or &#34; Superliner &#34;. As they edge way better from seeing at YouTube. Till now I don't know if they can trim for specific lengths. Still asking. They would cost you extra 20$. I left only 2 stars, because of the battery. Can't say I hate it. It's a decent trimmer. Update: 14/06/2014 So, since using this trimmer for 7 months, it paid for itself, and more! I bought Andis Superliner 4820 Model which supports both 110v + 220v, http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00791CU6K/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i01?ie=UTF8&psc=1 It came with attachments: 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, and 3/8. Which exactly what I want. I have a review there that you can check it out :) Comparing the two trimmers is not fair since they are in a different categories. But, for letting you know what was the difference between the two, or let's say between this and a wired trimmer that is from Andis or wahl, and can be zero gapped: Andis Superliner resolve all the complaints I said about the MB4040. With blade factory setting you can get as close as 0.1mm which will give you great edging, and when you zero gap the blade you would get a more precise edging, or closer shave. Blade cuts with less passes compared to MB4040 Attachments are better because they are rigid plastic not flimsy like MB4040 guard. Now, I will never think of buying a trimmer. Andis superliner seems that it will serve me for years, will, let's hope so :) Conclusion: MB4040 I would recommend it for people who travel. Battery, and decent trimming will definitely get the job done until you come back home. Or maybe with the collaboration with another razor you would get a stylish beard & mustache. Happy styling :) UPDATE: 25/02/2015 This trimmer is working strong. Battery is AWESOME. I am really impressed with the battery life. You will get to the point that you will forget that this battery actually need to be charged! INCREDIBLE battery life.

  486. I bought this on sale at a department store to replace the older [[ASIN:B0009OMU0A Remington MB-200 Beard Trimmer]] I own, because its battery is wearing out. But I'm going to be returning it the next time I go to the store.<br /><br />Maybe I got a \\"defective\\" unit, but I doubt it. Both the beard blade and the stubble blade randomly and repeatedly pulled at my beard hairs (which is quite unpleasant). The [[ASIN:B0009OMU0A Remington MB-200]] doesn't do that at all. And something about the slippery design of the plastic guard made it completely impossible to get a consistent trim. I tried shaving over the same areas MANY times and from multiple angles, but this thing just would *not* trim certain areas. The guard seems to just flatten the hairs down, instead of lifting them up into the blades. Despite how hot the bearded model is in the product photos, *I* ended up looking like I tried to shave with a blindfold on.<br /><br />Then I got out my [[ASIN:B0009OMU0A Remington MB-200]] and it cleaned up the mess left by this trimmer with zero hassle. So, I'll just buy a new one of those instead. I sure wish it had the Lithium battery though.
  487. I love the idea of this, being able to easily remove each cutting blade with the push of a button, the trimming guide snapping on easily, and the ergonomics are pretty great. I don't know if I just have exceptionally stubborn stubble or what, but I charged it up for the 24 hours, snapped on the stubble blade, and proceeded to pull out the hairs that have been making me look like an amish barnraiser. I checked the box to make sure I bought a trimmer and not an epilator, then tried again and yep, the trimmer just kept yanking hairs by the root instead of shearing them off. So beware on that.<br /><br />I've gotten used to the tricks now, it looks like this trimmer only goes one way. If I push it up my neck toward my jaw, everything cuts fine, but if I try to make a second pass by pulling the blade down my face, it's like some medieval torture device that only knows how to irritate my skin and make my eyes water. I know my beard can be a little majestic at times, but you'd think the &#34;lithium ion&#34; power would be enough to keep those whiskers at bay.

  489. I have purchased a wide range of shavers/trimmers from expensive Phillips and Braun to as cheap and disposable as Wahl's. I had this one for over a year now. As you might have guessed it, it is very reliable.<br /><br />First and foremost, the blades on this thing are top notch. Also the adjustable trimming height works perfectly. It is not water proof and you are discouraged to clean it under water, but I have done it several times (since it's not that expensive if I have to replace it) and I have no issues. It hasn't rusted and the trimmer still works electronically.<br /><br />This thing holds its charge like no other. Every other month or so I charge it because I think it shouldn't have any charge left because I use it at least once per week if not more and each time I operate this thing for at least 20 mins.<br /><br />Honestly, I do not know if there are any better trimmers out there. I used bleeding tech shaving/trimming stuff upwards of 300, and easily this is still the best. I am sure not everyone would agree with me but that is my personal opinion. If this stops working, I won't even look for another brand/model and buy this with no hesitation even if it costs 100 bucks (realistically it won't cost that much anyways).

  509. Have used it 3 or 4 times now, still haven't charged it since the 1st long one when I got it.<br />I upgraded from the pg350 (cheaper built model with lots of attachments).<br />I wanted a very close shave because I get rashes from using a blade. This unit cuts closer than the top of the line Wahl which my work colleague has, so that trimmer was off my list.<br />These blades are very sharp, but don't nick/cut my skin like my old ones did (maybe the old ones cut a tiny bit closer).<br />The edges of the cutting head are smooth and don't irritate if pressed along the skin.<br />I have coarse hair on my face. This shaver does not slow down even when I try to make it down and push it fast. It is quite thorough, it does not pull/pinch the hairs, and on a second run over the same area you can hear that there is minimal hair being removed, meaning many passes are not required (not like my last one). I am impressed by the power of the lithium battery and so far have not found the maximum number of shaves her charge. It takes me about 10mins now (using the closest full width head attachment with no guide attached), down from about 15 for my old one (although my old ones closest cut attachment was a 17mm head).<br />It is very light, which feels cheap. But I did not subtract any stars in my rating because it does give a very close shave, has a lithium battery, and is less than $35. I knew it was made in China and am happy with my product.<br />The shape of the product is a little more curved than I was expecting, but does not impede any area of clipping, probably helps get under the chin on an upward stroke.

  521. # This replaces an older Remington model with nicad battery finally failed after 12+ years.<br /># Bought this four months ago, in March, 2014, for $29.99.<br /># This one has good battery life, I'd estimate I can trim my beard 6+ times before needing a recharge, at roughly 5-10 minutes per use.<br /># The length guide is easily adjusted or removed. The blade heads are easily swapped (I don't use the third narrow goatee trimmer).<br /># The fine head trims edges, neck and stubble more closely, and, being middle aged, it trims random ear and nose hairs well (note to self: use only the fine head for trimming, as the regular head can nick corners of nostrils).<br /># The regular blade head for trimming my beard works well enough but doesn't quite cut it all, literally. I set the guide to &#34;3&#34; or &#34;4&#34; -- with &#34;9&#34; being longest. The main issue I have is that it randomly misses a dozen or so hairs scattered most noticeable around the upper lip, mouth edges and under the lower lip, even if I go over areas multiple times from different angles. I have to spend some extra time finding and trimming these with scissors for a couple of days. This was not a problem with my previous Remington.<br /># A minor issue is that it snags or pulls hairs once or twice when I trim my beard. It's like plucking a hair with tweezers. Annoying.<br /># I give it a score of 3 of 5 due to the missed hairs and snagged hairs. I'll probably use this until it wears out after years of use, but then I'll likely try a different trimmer.

  543. This is my fourth Remington beard trimmer. All the others have batteries or chargers that have died or are in the process of dying. Ok, but why do I keep buying them? The reason I like the trimmers is that they have a very short length setting -- which suits my preferences. I was excited to see a Lithium-Ion version but I was disappointed on two significant counts. First, the shortest setting (1) is equivalent in length to the 2 or 3 setting on my other Remington trimmers. I think they took a giant step backwards here. The other problem is that after coming out with a 220V compatible charger on my previous Remington trimmer charger, this Li-Ion version has reverted to a 110V only. I travel a lot internationally and this is my ONLY electronic product that is not compatible with most of the world. Another giant step backwards.

It did it with no problem, I am really happy with it, and it holds a charge for what seems like forever. Clippers are sharp, easy to use, could not have made a better purchase.

  558. I have charged this thing ONLY 3 times since I have had it. It holds a charge for a long time. Now I do not use it every day, but at least 3-4 times a week for trimming. It works great as well. The charging cord could be made a lot better. It is one of those cords that will eventually break right near the part tha plugs into the shaver if you are not careful. I charge mine, then hide the plug in the drawer until next charge. Charging light would be nice if it would tell you when the battery is about to die, or show what the remaining power is, but for the price, that is no big deal. The final thing is that it will not charge while using it, which means, if it dies, you can't use it until it is charged. Battery life is the biggest plus. For $29, you can't go wrong.
  559. Battery stopped working after 2 month, this product is useless, horrible battery.
  560. Works Great. I like the three different cutters. Holds charge very well.
  561. excellent product. Fast shipment. A++
  562. I don't like it a lot.<br />Cons:<br />Very noisy<br />No speed adjustment<br />Shape is kind of awkward<br />I am planning to buy the 4550
  563. 10/26/14 - Worked great as a trimmer, but now 1.5 years in the battery will no longer hold a charge. Says 2 years warranty, will try to see how my luck goes getting it repaired. Update 10/28/14 - Called Remington as the comment below recommended, and in less than 5 minutes a replacement trimmer is on the way at no cost to me, with a pre-paid return shipping label. Great customer service! Have modified review from a 3-star to a 4-star. Will update if situation changes but I expect to be a satisfied customer and will buy Remington from Amazon again.

  570. I use this every other day and I love the attachments and the ability to trim my beard to a certain length. The best part of this is the fact that it's rechargeable. The charge on this trimmer last forever I have only charged it once with almost 2 months of use on it. Very good buy and I highly recommend this trimmer.<br /><br />UPDATE: 5/4/14<br /><br />Well I have had it just over 3 months now, and I have only had to fully charge it twice. That is pretty dang good if you ask me. But I do want to add some details. The shave using the blades is not super close but good enough for a good stubble. But hair will often find its way inside under the blades where they then get stuck in the factory applied grease so that is kind of a pain. That will eventually get gummed up but nothing too bad. Also want to add that the plastic attachment for trimming you beard to a specified length, the plastic attachment is kind of flimsy and even if you apply just a little more pressure it will trim to a shorter length. Furthermore the trim length selection wheel is easy to accidentally bump while trimming causing it to fly down to the shortest length. I did that once, and then I just had to shave my beard real short. I was not happy. So in general it is a great beard trimmer with amazing battery life. but the hair can gum the inside of the trimmer up, and the plastic beard trimmer is flimsy, and last the wheel for selecting trim length needs a lock feature to prevent someone from accidentally turning it while shaving.<br /><br />PRO:<br />Great battery life<br />Rechargeable<br />Multiple attachments<br />Trim selection wheel<br />Good shave<br />Fast<br />Powerful motor<br />Easy to change blades<br />Sleek look<br /><br />CONS:<br />Hair can gum up under the blades<br />Loud<br />Flimsy plastic beard trimming guard (want to add that if you trim with the wrong angle using this you will shave to the skin)<br />Trim length wheel needs a lock feature to prevent changing when in use.<br /><br />Still a great buy for the price!!!!!<br /><br />UPDATE PLEASE READ!!!! THIS IS TO THE MANY THAT RATE THIS LOW STARS.<br /><br />Ok after spending some time reading the low reviews I want to add a few things.<br />First there are 3 blades with this trimmer. Below I will describe them for further use in this review.<br /><br />Ok looking at the pictures on this amazon product description page I will refer to the 3rd picture from the top in the description.<br />So the 3 blades are as follows.<br /><br />1. Beard Trimming Blade. (This is the big blade with the wide teeth)<br />2. Goatee Trimming Blade. (This is the one with the small cutting blade with fine teeth)<br />3. Stubble Trimming Blade. (This is the one with the same length blade as the Beard Blade but it has finer teeth)<br /><br />Ok so many users complain that they cut themselves when using this trying to shave their bare skin. So use this guide line.<br /><br />The Beard Trimming Blade is only supposed to be used with the plastic guide for TRIMMING YOUR BEARD NOT SHAVING YOUR FACE.<br />I have used the stubble blade on my neck, but I don't care for that blade much.<br />After trimming my beard a little with the Beard Trimming Blade AND THE PLASTIC GUIDE. I then use the GOATEE TRIMMING BLADE TO SHAVE TO MY BARE SKIN, so I use the GOATEE Blade to shave my neck and the edge of my chin strap to keep it styled. And I HAVE NEVER BEEN CUT USING THE GOATEE BLADE I just shave strips under my neck until I am finished. So ONLY USE THE BIG BEARD BLADE WHEN YOU ARE TRIMMING, AND NOT SHAVING YOUR BEARD, AND YOU HAVE TO USE THE GUIDE WITH THIS BLADE. 2. USE THE SMALL GOATEE BLADE FOR ALL OTHER SHAVING THAT INVOLVES SHAVING TO BARE SKIN LIKE UNDER YOUR CHIN AND ON YOUR NECK.<br /><br />Also there are some general guidelines to use when dealing with lithium ion batteries.<br /><br />First don't let them drain all the way that can ruin the battery life.<br />Also don't let them sit for a long time without charging doa maintenance charge like once a month.<br /><br />can't post links but just Google how to charge and maintain lithium ion batteries.<br /><br />Follow these few rules and you won't cut yourself when using this. And at least look into how to safely use and charge lithium ion batteries. Not all things are maintenance free.<br /><br />UPDATE 4/27/2016!!!!!!!<br />I have had this for a little over 2 years now, and have only charged the battery less than 10 times. In fact, I haven't even charged it yet this year. I use it about once a week to trim up my beard, and it always works. I have read several bad reviews regarding the battery. Make sure when you buy it to follow the directions and FULLY charge it when you open the package. After that, I only charge it when it is dead or very low, and that seems to do the trick for me. This is the best beard trimmer I have ever used. Two years later, and I still highly recommend buying this, and just read the instructions and follow them.<br /><br />UPDATE 3/20/2017!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br /><br />THIS LASTED ABOUT 3 YEARS. It's dead now. The battery won't even hold a charge for more than 20 seconds before it strains to cut hair. Still 3 years isn't too bad for a $30 beard trimmer. I need to find another one to buy. Not sure if I will buy the same one. Maybe I'll look for some that have replaceable rechargeable batteries. Like phone batteries.

  593. I've used several of the Remington MB line of trimmers over the past 10-years to groom my full beard. The old trimmers had a bad habit of losing the ability to correctly hold a charge after a couple years. This unit works exactly as the old trimmers did: with 9 length settings for triming, a simple on/off switch, and a guard that easily comes off for cleaning the unit of cut hair. There's no loud vacuum included, there's no useless secondary trimmer to pop open randomly, and -- most importantly -- there's no useless touch screen included in this model. I charged my unit overnight after receiving it and have been using it for a couple weeks now without it needing a recharge. It moves effortlessly through my beard and seems to trim it well, arguably better than the old units. In addition to \\"classing up\\" the design of this unit, the weight has been re-balanced so that the head is heavier than the handle, which makes shaping a beard (particularly cutting in the direction of growth, for a longer beard) nearly effortless. I love this trimmer and hope I never have to buy another one again now that it's using Li-Ion batteries.
  594. The Mustache and beard trimmer works perfectly, especially when you are travelling. The trimmer is small, effective and very convenient.
  595. I was a little afraid when I looked at the pictures of this product. It has 3 different heads for trimming different things which is really nice but it looks like you have to use a screwdriver to switch out each head. Thankfully this isn't the case. Each head is screwed into a plastic case which easily snaps into the main trimmer device. To take it out you push a button and pull it out to easily replace it with a different one.<br /><br />The plastic protector feels smooth against my skin as I trim my goatee. I love how easily it trims and how close of a shave I get when doing the sides of my face.
  596. The trimmer is versatile, easy to use, and generally a good trimmer (especially for the price). At the beginning, it charged quickly and held a charge for quite a while.
